definition: to say one and mean just that (idiom); to keep one's word
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: The old squad leader is a man of his word; he never makes a promise he cannot keep.
sentences.chinese: 老班長是說一不二的，他答應的事一定能辦到。

sentences.english: But good husbands take their wives at their word.
sentences.chinese: 但好丈夫對妻子總是說一不二。

sentences.english: They had today is sky, say a not two, you never can defy.
sentences.chinese: 他們曾今是天，說一不二，你從不能違抗。
